intro: Adicea lindeniana, commonly known as the yellow balm, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Adicea lindeniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
